meanings.definition: The quality of being strongly reminiscent or suggestive of something.
meanings.sent1: The redolence of the old book brought back memories of childhood.
meanings.sent2: The redolence of fresh flowers filled the room with a sweet fragrance.
meanings.sent3: The redolence of grandma's cookies always made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The redolence of nostalgia lingered in the air, transporting me to another time.
meanings.sent5: The redolence of the past was so vivid, it felt like I could almost touch it.

meanings.sent1: The redolence of baking bread wafted through the kitchen, making everyone hungry.
meanings.sent2: The redolence of pine trees in the forest was invigorating.
meanings.sent3: The redolence of fresh coffee in the morning always woke me up with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The redolence of success was in the air as the team celebrated their victory.
meanings.sent5: The redolence of happiness enveloped the room, spreading joy to all who entered.
